result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M. Ponti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -  $1248 payable to JESO for repayment of extradition fees.

-  Any assessment, treatment, counseling per the Agent. 
-  Obtain/maintain employment per the Agent. 
-  Comply with ALL family court orders particularly regarding child support. 
-  Make all child support payments on time. 
-  Make all payments on arrearages according to the child support orders. 
-  Within 5 days of sentencing, the defendant shall report to the child support agency located in Room 219 of the Jefferson County Courthouse at 311 South Center Ave., Jefferson, WI 53549 to complete a case management meeting. (Unless this has already occurred.)
-  Make all payments towards child support and arrearages through the: Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200, Milwaukee, WI 53274-0200 (not through the Department of Corrections.) 
-  Advise the Child Support Office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such a change. 
-  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin without DOC approval. 

Arresting Agency: JC Child Support

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M. Ponti

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
With JI's instructions and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:24am.  Clerk - CRHI.  (Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Br. 4.)
Defendant Anthony M. Ponti in court with attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AMENDED Information filed by the State. 
Service admitted, reading waived. 
Terms of the agreement reached by the parties, reviewed by the Court. 
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
Count #1, #2, #3, #4 and #5 of the AMENDED INFORMATION - NO CONTEST plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.
Victim impact statement submitted by the State and reviewed by the Court. 
Recommendations presented by counsel.
Statement presented by the defendant. 
The Court orders withholds sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 years on each count concurrent with conditions. The defendant has 23 days credit for time served. 
CONDITIONS:
-  Costs - $243 on each count. 
-  DNA Surcharge - $200 on each count. 
-  $1248 payable to JESO for repayment of extradition fees. 
-  Any assessment, treatment, counseling per the Agent. 
-  Obtain/maintain employment per the Agent. 
-  Comply with ALL family court orders particularly regarding child support. 
-  Make all child support payments on time. 
-  Make all payments on arrearages according to the child support orders. 
-  Within 5 days of sentencing, the defendant shall report to the child support agency located in Room 219 of the Jefferson County Courthouse at 311 South Center Ave., Jefferson, WI 53549 to complete a case management meeting. (Unless this has already occurred.)
-  Make all payments towards child support and arrearages through the: Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200, Milwaukee, WI 53274-0200 (not through the Department of Corrections.) 
-  Advise the Child Support Office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such a change. 
-  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin without DOC approval.

The Court adjourns.

Case called at 2:04 pm
Defendant Anthony M. Ponti appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Complaint admitted; Court confirms address and date of birth on the complaint are accurate for Mr. Ponti; charges/penalties recited; reading waived;

Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Ponti qualifies for SPD Representation
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support charges
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1000 cash bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Kirsten Crock
-Not leave State of Wisconsin during pendency of this action
-Appear at preliminary hearing 3/14/14

Court finds warrant has been served

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 3/14/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
